result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerrell Lamont Clark

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Jerrell Lamont Clark. Prosecuting Attorney Kaylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 21CF690 & 21CF210. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer R. Schwabenlander. Testimony heard. State requests an adjournment. Case is adjourned for a continued preliminary hearing as to count 2.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Jerrell Lamont Clark.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel is in a Jury Trial and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark not in court, defendant in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. States requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Addie B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No driving without a valid license.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jerrell Lamont Clark in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
